bwwExcerpt: The show has been updated to include a few new zingers. For instance, God announces that he knows full well that the crowd is only there because they couldn't get tickets to "Hamilton." In fact, God can't snag a ticket, either. Even at just 90 minutes, "An Act of God" (directed by the prolific Joe Mantello) is long-winded and full of unoriginal jabs at easy targets, but it is cute and occasionally witty . showScoreExcerpt:
"It's a very funny, very promising concept, but not much of a play or even a stand-up routine...Even at 90 minutes, 'An Act of God' is long-winded and full of unoriginal jabs at common targets. There may be a play to be drawn out of Javerbaum's work, but 'An Act of God' is not it."
